channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: In Graphics | Is Europe breaking up with US tech?
Why Pakistan Army chief Asim Munir’s visit to Bahawalpur has grabbed India’s attention
Explained: The challenges awaiting the new US Fed chair
How an infant was stabbed 600 times with a needle by a Chinese mother
Were trillions of dollars were wiped out from gold and silver within minutes?
Sunetra Pawar or… Who could be Ajit Pawar’s successor?
All is not well in Beijing: How Xi’s grip on power is being tested like never before
item.description: For the first time since consolidating absolute authority, Xi Jinping appears politically isolated—presiding over a powerful military stripped of its most experienced generals and a party shaken by fear, purges and mistrust

item.title: Two billion people, one global order: How India-EU mega trade deal is a game changer
item.description: The EU will scrap all tariffs on 90 per cent of Indian goods, and within seven years, this will be extended to 93 per cent

item.title: One year of Al Sharaa: Syria’s fragile transition amid ethnic tensions and international pressures
item.description: Syrian President Ahmed Al Sharaa’s main problem has been the integration of rival ethnic groups like the Druze, Kurds, Alawites, and Christians, who have their historic grievances and fear Sunni Arab domination

item.title: For US, India is both an ally and adversary
item.description: Not only will India in the 2050s be the world’s largest democracy but also the world’s largest economy.

item.title: US Sutra | America is at war with itself: Minnesota is just the tip of the iceberg
item.description: The shooting of Alex Pretti on January 24 in the ongoing Minnesota siege has once again foregrounded the deep divisions in the American state and society.

item.title: Venezuela and India’s red line on Bangladesh: What Delhi should learn from Trump’s raid
item.description: India defined its red lines by pulverising terror bases in Pakistan during Operation Sindoor. Now it is time to set a red line on Bangladesh
